definition: to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged

sentences.english: Maintaining a sense of humor about these new frustrations can be helpful.
sentences.chinese: 对新出现的种种懊丧局面保持幽默感，这会有所帮助。

sentences.english: The club understand the frustrations of people not knowing.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部也理解不知情的人的懊丧。

sentences.english: Her face showed her dejection at missing the party.
sentences.chinese: 她因错过聚会而面露懊丧之色。

sentences.english: Regret to the south, feel I dont deserve west chicken, filed for divorce.
sentences.chinese: 向南懊丧，感觉本人配不上西凤，提出了离婚。

sentences.english: He was chagrined at his failure.
The sun never repents of the good he does, nor does he ever demand a recompence.
sentences.chinese: 太阳绝不为它所做的善事懊丧，也从不盼望任何报酬。

definition: to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
